title: [Large-scale] Linear Motion Graph Learning Module: Short-Term Intensive Course Based on the ASSURE Model

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental physics concepts (velocity, acceleration, distance)
context.additional_context: Integrated online/offline learning environment utilizing personal devices (BYOD). Operation of a formative assessment-centered feedback system

learning_goals: Students can interpret linear motion graphs (time-displacement, time-velocity) and quantitatively describe motion states.
Students can accurately perform over 80% of the problem-solving process for motion graph questions using the Predict-Observe-Explain (POE) approach.
Students can convert complex motion data into structured visual materials by applying chunking and graphic techniques.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
